sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: What is the scale factor of the Barnsley fern if the original fern measures 5 cm and the largest sub-fern measures 1 cm?
message_2:
The scale factor can be found by dividing the size of the largest sub-fern by the size of the original fern. In this case, the scale factor is:

1 cm (size of the largest sub-fern) / 5 cm (size of the original fern) = 1/5 = 0.2

So, the scale factor of the Barnsley fern is 0.2.
